reviews.review_msg: Pros: Helpful, knowledgeable, passionate, good person.  Cons: Assignments are confusing, hard to sit with him for three hours, loses track of time.  I'd take another class with him.

Yes he seemed really passionate to teach. However, the lecture was so hard to sit through (3hr) and he was the most disorganized prof i have ever had. Explanation to assignments are all over the place, not clear and concise at all. We had to write two different midterms because he emailed the answer key to the whole class before exam. 331,a regret
Amir is very passionate about his teaching. He gives his cell phone to the class so you can call him if you want. I did my home work and I got a good mark. That's fair :)
Amir is excited about the topic and a wonderful teacher.

Devan is at the U of A now in the political science department but I can hands down say he is the best TA I have ever had. He has clear expectations for us and comes up with fun ways of engaging with the readings.
Amazing TA who goes above and beyond for every student. For the final exam he had drop-in office hours for over 5 hours! Really respect him and hope to have him as a TA in the future.
The lecture's boring and such a hard marker. I will never take his class again.
I'd retake this course in a minute.  So interesting!  Expectations were extremely clear.  Everything was set out on the first day of classes.  Lectures were recorded.  21st century learning!
Excellent professor.  Very clearly set out expectations.  One of the best professors and one of the best courses I took in my undergraduate degree.  Very fair marker.

This class was fascinating. I learned so much, and yes, bob's lectures can be dry at times, but if you engage and concentrate in his class you will learn so much from this brilliant man! Don't worry about doing the readings as much as attending the lectures and taking detailed notes.
DRY lectures. He makes sure you go to lectures with his "quick writes". Hard marker ugh! NEVER will I ever take a class with him again. GPA dropper for sure.
He's professional and expected a lot for students. Interesting topic but hard to learn so. HARD MARKER

I found him to be friendly, helpful, somewhat dry (he does not use powerpoint in his lectures, you will only get the odd overhead now and then) but very thorough.  Interesting course content, definitely an advanced kind of lecture. Overall not bad!

Yes, Bob Hackett can be dry and pofessorial, but after all, he is a professor. I found his lectures very intelligent and cohesive, and his knowledge level extremely high. He's sort of an advanced professor, requiring advanced students.
attendance in lecture? what the hell? truly a boring lecturer.. not a good professor to talk to in person. VERY stubborn
Very disorganized TA, never prepared for tutorial and makes things up on the spot. Went to office hours with him and he couldn't explain anything. Such a joke.
Chris is an awesome TA. Super friendly and knows what he's talking about. Approachable and gives great advice. Thanks Chris for all your hard-work!
he really made a late evening class through Zoom enjoyable! tutorials were always fun and interesting. marks nicely
He's so nice and really wants everyone to do well! Very accessible outside of class. Easy marker.

Nawal was a great prof for 304! She explained the concepts clearly and would make sure everyone understood before she moved on. She was a little strict, but it didnt take away from the course itself. Would take another class with her

Nawal is a great lecturer and her class was one of my favourites! 
She is really talented at breaking down complex theories or ideas and making them more understandable.
She is also super nice and willing to help. When I went to her office hours she gave me tons of feedback on my paper proposal which really helped improve it.

I first had Nawal as a TM so I knew her going into the class, which was helpful. Get to know her and she is really helpful when it comes to assignments, really wants to help you do well with papers. Likes to talk a lot so beware of some long, boring lectures, but she's passionate about what she teaches. Participation is key. Definitely recommend.

Excellent prof. Probably one of the best at SFU. Kathy is incredibly clear in lecture and when outlining midterms as well as assignments. Even if you don't have an interest in news, her lectures make it semi enjoyable and relatively easy to pass.
This seminar course was really enjoyable, from the lively discussion to the super relevant topics (current events), and Ahmed's teaching style and good spirit was definitely a part of that.

Ahmed was a great teacher for this course. I took this course during the early emergence of COVID-19 in the spring term of 2020. He was a great, understanding prof that always made sure our questions were answered. There is a fair amount of work for weekly assignments but as long as you are in lecture and pay attention, the course isn't difficult.

Ahmed is my favourite professor at SFU. He is so understanding and caring towards his students. He is also very passionate about what he teaches which makes all his courses very exciting. I took CMNS 201 with him as well and loved it! Best professor ever!
rad.  very helpful, etnertaining and smart. tough marker, but reasonably so.
